attributes.background: The air toxicity is reaching dangerous levels in central London, and pedestrianizing it would not only make the air cleaner and healthier, but would make London a safer place for pedestrians and cyclists. This will all contribute towards making the city greener, which is paramount for our future.

rejection.details:
This would be a decision for local authorities and perhaps also the London Assembly.

Westminster Council has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here: http://petitions.westminster.gov.uk/

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions

You might like to take advice from one of these about who exactly would be responsible for this.
